meanings.definition: A pledge or security for the performance of an act.
meanings.sent1: He offered his watch as a gage for the borrowed money.
meanings.sent2: The knight left his sword as a gage of his loyalty.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel playfully used a nut as a gage in their game.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a gage of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The handshake served as a gage of their agreement.

meanings.sent1: The duel was a gage of honor between the two knights.
meanings.sent2: His refusal to back down was a clear gage of his determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat's stare was a playful gage to the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her raised eyebrow was a gage of her skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds were a gage of nature's power.

meanings.definition: To give as security or assurance.
meanings.sent1: He decided to gage his car to secure the loan.
meanings.sent2: She gaged her necklace to show her commitment.
meanings.sent3: The child gaged his favorite toy to his friend.
meanings.sent4: The gesture gaged their trust in each other.
meanings.sent5: She gaged her support by attending the event.

meanings.definition: To measure the dimensions of something.
meanings.sent1: The tailor carefully gaged the fabric before cutting.
meanings.sent2: He gaged the room to see if the furniture would fit.
meanings.sent3: The scientist gaged the temperature of the liquid.
meanings.sent4: She gaged the distance to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter gaged the wood for the perfect fit.
